oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Kris Kristofferson interview - Ralph Emery - Part 2 - 1980-02-26
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of an interview with Kris Kristofferson conducted by Ralph Emery on February 26, 1980.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Kristofferson talks about his first television appearance -- Kristofferson talks about appearing on the Grammys -- Emery checks the interview length -- Kristofferson talks about rumors -- Kristofferson talks about quitting drinking for the past 3 years and quitting to watch his daughter grow up and because he didn't like the way he looked on interviews while drunk -- Kristofferson says that at the height of his drinking he'd drink a bottle and a half of whiskey a day along with beer -- Kristofferson says he thought he had to be drunk to perform to prevent stage-fright -- Kristofferson talks about still being scared when acting and performing -- Kristofferson recalls Johnny Cash being scared before a performance just weeks before the interview -- Emery says veteran entertainers are more fearful of their peers rather than audiences -- Kristofferson talks about writing "For The Good Times" -- Kristofferson talks about his favorite recording of his songs by another artist and how he likes them all for different reasons -- Kristofferson talks about his huge respect for Waylon Jennings -- Kristofferson talks about "Why Me, Lord?" and how he had a religious experience during the writing -- Kristofferson feels embarrassed talking about religion -- Emery thanks Kristofferson for being on the show
